allianceInfo.summary: The "High-Throughput Protein Microarray Technology and Biomedical Industry Service Alliance" is an initiative based at National Cheng Kung University (NCKU) in Tainan, Taiwan. It operates within the Department of Food Safety/Hygiene and Risk Management, College of Medicine, at NCKU.
allianceInfo.mission: The alliance's primary mission is to advance the application of high-throughput protein microarray technology within the biomedical sector. It serves as a platform for collaboration between academia and industry, aiming to accelerate progress in areas such as precision medicine, antibody screening, disease diagnosis, and the development of biomarkers.
allianceInfo.objectivesTitle: Key objectives and services provided by the alliance include:
objectives: Offering high-throughput protein production, purification, and microarray technologies to support clinical research and biotechnology applications.
Establishing a blood antibody biomarker library to foster precision diagnostics and biomedical research.
Providing customized microarray chip services to enhance the value of biotech products and improve research and development efficiency.
Promoting industry-academic partnerships to develop novel microarray technologies and their applications.
Providing advanced whole-genome protein microarrays capable of analyzing thousands of proteins from various organisms (e.g., E. coli, yeast, human).
Conducting clinical research and diagnostics, including screening for disease biomarkers.
Performing drug target analysis to aid pharmaceutical companies in new drug development and understanding drug mechanisms.
Utilizing antibody microarray chips for signaling pathway analysis and biomarker research.
Offering customized technical services for small-scale multiplex testing solutions.
